fields.headline: Travel tips
fields.bodyText: Don't bother to cart all your shoe cleaning gear on a trip - simply apply a dab of liquid skin cleanser. It is a quick and handy way of reviving the shine on polished shoes. David Hunter South Africa operates a VAT refund service for tourists. You can reclaim VAT of 14% at the airport on purchases that are exported from the country. You should obtain a leaflet at the airport or from a tourist shop when arriving, which states exactly what must be on each invoice (you need to adhere to this). On departure, show the VAT officials all the items that you have purchased along with the invoices. You then take the invoices to a VAT refund desk, where you will be issued with a cheque which you can cash at Thomas Cook. The whole process takes an hour, so allow plenty of time, and only do it if the amount you will get back makes it worthwhile.
